TextView.android:text:
Have a look in this advanced1 setup, we have a few more concepts:
 
 + Screens - which is also a fragment, very similar to Singles
 it is designed to belong to a journey ONLY,
 it does not have it own SDK but shared with the whole journey it belong to
 
 + Navigator - which is ALWAYS stick with a journey,
 to implement the route of journey's children (singles, screens, and even another child journey)
 has a few function to navigate between fragments (for example: NextScreen, PopScreen)
 
 + Journeys - a simple fragment contains (most of the time) only the navigation inside,
 follows the customer journey concept, it will manage a few 'screens' to achieve customer's need
 using Android Navigation, you will list the journey screens on it, and define the action to navigate around
 
 + NOTE: journey has it own Route too, follow the basic concept of pluggable
